channel.title: Port forwarding!
channel.description: I have a server all up and ready to go..but when I go to canyouseeme.org, and check the port, it says its not open! i've opened port 43594 in windows firewall, and I have 43594 forwarded in my router, but it still says its not open! what is wrong?!?

item.title: Port forwarding!
item.dc:creator: @Warsham Warsham
item.description:
@Warsham wrote:

[quote=“laurent 248, post:4, topic:361143”][quote author=Warsham link=topic=457430.msg3347745#msg3347745 date=1284950096]
Windows 7?

What I had to do, was make sure that I was in Static, rather than Dynamic.
How to do this?

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

If you are using Windows 7, it will be different to find, but it works the same and can fix the issues.
(I had everything right but my IP was Dynamic and not Static, once I changed it, I can now log in with the no-ip server)

Good luck.
[/quote]

Why everybody says its different for windows 7?? i got a windows 7, my old computers was a vista and xp. i dont see any difference if its not the interface or something…[/quote]
Yes, that was my point.
The interface and finding the protocol properties works differently in Windows 7.

Read full topic

@monkey_money30 wrote:

A good idea is to go to www.portforward.com, it’s got almost every guide on how to portforward with almost every router.

item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

a lot of times it isn’t actually the portforwarding. Make sure you have the variables in the right area. http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,193370.0.html

item.title: Port forwarding!

Windows 7?

What I had to do, was make sure that I was in Static, rather than Dynamic.

programming, irc, cars
